urls.title: ESMA warns firms and investors about risks arising from payment for
urls.description: The European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA), the EU‚Äôs securities markets regulator, is issuing a public statement to remind firms that the receipt of payment for order flow (PFOF) raises significant investor protection concerns. It also highlights key MiFID II obligations aimed at ensuring firms act in their clients‚Äô best interest when executing their orders.

text:
PFOF = practice of brokers receiving payments from third parties for directing client order flow to them as execution venues.

PFOF incentivises the firm to choose the third party offering the highest payment, rather than the best outcome for its clients.
